Posts.Content: Hi Staffylove, I too could not inject myself and I am a nurse. When asked on the unit was I happy to do this I thought I could..... roll forward to the Friday evening of the first injection and me and my OH needed up back on the chemo unit as I couldn't do the injection and the oH was a bit worried about doing it. We got shown well he did and then bless him he has done it every time since.... I absolutely hate injections, so please don't feel too bad about the nurses coming out to you as that would of been my next option. its soon all done and dusted.... good luck.  Tess58
Posts.Title: Immune boosting injections

Posts.Content: Todays walk of 2 miles in the hail and rain! Cold and not good at the start but I was warm at the end except my fingers!!!There was a Kingfisher on the log .... really there was but he/she flew off !
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: LeoLady, What a brilliant idea. especially with Spring around the corner to get us motivated if we can. If not on those 'grotto bag days ' we can look at the pics and think perhaps tomorrow or next week. Here is a picture of my walk last week in between the rain.  Poppy and Douglas happy to rest with me whilst OH is off taking pics of some wildlife. Got home and did nothing though. 3 miles and I was pooped.  Moys
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lynne1402.......Oh I'm really sorry that you've had to join the club it is pants but hold on tight it will be sorted.. I was diagnosed in September and am due to start Chemo next week. At times I thought I need to start right now but 'they' work it all out and design drugs and a programme specifically for your 'bad lump' in order to be rid off.... try and enjoy your holiday, and all will be there on your return... there is a light at the end of the tunnel , just hold on tight . xx
Posts.Title: Diagnised today.......feel a bit lost!

Posts.Content: My GP has prescribed Replens after discontinuing my oestrogen based cream. But it didn't help much, but I was in Boots yesterday and found some pessaries ( balance activ). So I thought I would give them a try!! So I'm thinking of trying both!! You have to keep your sense of humour with all this malarky. Its good (?!) to hear that other ladies have similar problems, you begin to think its 'just you'.

Posts.Content: Hi BIBI44, brilliant blog thank you for posting. However I can't find anything on the topic above..... I probably can't see for looking!! any ideas on how to help me!!! LOL... cheers  Tess  58
